concise_definition: v. 相信, 信奉, 认为

definitions.explanation_en: To accept something as true or real, often without absolute proof, based on trust, faith, or personal conviction.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指在缺乏绝对证据的情况下，基于信任、信仰或个人信念而接受某事为真或真实。
definitions.example_en: I believe that honesty is the best policy in relationships.
definitions.example_cn: 我相信在人际关系中，诚实是最好的准则。

definitions.explanation_en: To have confidence in the reliability, truth, or ability of someone or something.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指对某人或某物的可靠性、真实性或能力抱有信心。
definitions.example_en: She believes in her team’s ability to win the championship.
definitions.example_cn: 她相信她的团队有能力赢得冠军。

definitions.explanation_en: To hold a religious or philosophical conviction; to accept a doctrine or set of principles as true.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指持有宗教或哲学上的信仰，接受某种教义或原则为真理。
definitions.example_en: He believes in the power of meditation to bring inner peace.
definitions.example_cn: 他相信冥想具有带来内心平静的力量。

comparison.analysis: “Think” (认为) 更侧重于理性思考后的判断或意见，常用于表达主观看法，不一定涉及情感或信仰。例如：I think it’s going to rain。而 “believe” 更强调深层的信念或情感认同，常带有价值观或信仰色彩，如：I believe in justice。
“Trust” (信任) 强调对他人或系统的依赖和安全感，通常基于过去的经验或可靠性。例如：I trust my doctor to give me good advice。而 “believe” 更关注对陈述、观点或事实真实性的接受，不一定涉及依赖关系。
“Accept” (接受) 指在理智上承认某事为真或成立，但可能缺乏情感投入或内在认同。例如：I accept the facts, but I don’t like them。而 “believe” 暗示更深层次的心理认同，甚至可能影响行为和态度。
